messages: c938c62ecadcab91676bdf5e857fb8ca (18:29): G'day everyone.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:34): just made http://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Changes_from_HTML4#New_Attributes
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:42): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 - have you or anybody else written up a brief description of the html5 parsing algorithm?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:42): briefer than reading the whole wepapps1.0 spec, I mean
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:42): how would that work?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:42): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I have written a very short goal-level description twice
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:43): looks them up
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:43): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 - also wanted to ask if your PDF version of the webapps1.0 spec is linked to on the site anywhere
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:43): http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/thesis/html5-conformance-checker.xhtml#p122
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:44): (unstable fragment id)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:44): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: it is linked to on my site. not on whatwg.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:44): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 - OK, thanks

9fdcde97c1cb33fe4e9f6aab1d84bc76 (18:45): what is the reasoning for allowing <font> when inserted by WYSIWYG editors. there are no such editors for HTML5 yet, so any ones that come along can be made without using <font>
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:46): <font> isn't done yet
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:46): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: the other one is in http://groups.google.fi/group/comp.infosystems.www.authoring.html/msg/963cbf7f54567bff
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:47): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I think it would make sense to generate Letter and A4 PDFs is a post-commit hook on the Dreamhost server
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:47): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: but that requires the appropriate Prince license
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:48): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 - yeah, that would be good. I think Mike Day would probably be happy to give you license
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:48): 9fdcde97c1cb33fe4e9f6aab1d84bc76, " Usage varies widely by language." sounds like commentary
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:48): would be good to have the PDF linked to straight from the online (HTML) spec
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:49): 9fdcde97c1cb33fe4e9f6aab1d84bc76, the quotes from those elements (<b> too) is taken literally from the HTML5 spec...
9fdcde97c1cb33fe4e9f6aab1d84bc76 (18:49): well i am trying to point out that "ship names" is just English
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:49): s/quotes/description/
9fdcde97c1cb33fe4e9f6aab1d84bc76 (18:49): oh right. shame that isn't a wiki too
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:50): shrugs
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:50): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, arrange it :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:54): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 - I'd be happy to. Is there currently any kind of build that runs when the spec is updated (using make or ant or whatever)?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:54): if you arrange some script that makes a PDF I'm sure Hixie can integrate it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:55): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 - you want to contact Prince/Mike Day and ask about the license? Or you want me to?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:56): lol, Dao is funny
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:56): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 - and I don't find any link for the PDF on your home page
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:56): he suggests that XSLT can be used but then he never used it...
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (18:57): Is that the html60 guy?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:57): no
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:57): <email/>
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:00): ah, "Printing Web Apps 1.0" . I see it now
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (19:01): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: should be under blogish notes
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:02): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 - yeah, got it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (19:02): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: it would be nice if you contacted him
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:03): OK, will do
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:03): do you guys have shell access to the Dreamhost server?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:03): only Hixie I guess
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (19:04): I think Hixie is the only one with the required level of access
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:04): heh, people did indeed want to remove <div> (re: last post)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:04): and <b> and <i> are back in
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:05): and all for reasons of more "semantic" markup
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (19:05): to my knowledge, Lachy and zcorpan are sandboxed away from the spec virtual host
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (19:05): well, I guess we don't necessarily need to have the PDF build script run on the Dreamhost server
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:06): just give the script to Hixie; the main thing is the license for Prince
